knimeNode.name: Correlation
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates the correlation coefficients between corresponding groups from different subsets.

fullDescription.intro:
The output will be a new table that contains the as many rows as possible permutations between the subsets times the number of groups. The selector to define variables can also exclude all columns.
Note that you should use the nominal filter to make a selection of the subsets and groups. Otherwise the correlation table will become huge and the calculation will last a long, long time.
fullDescription.option: For measuring correlation there are the Pearson-Correlation-Coefficient and the Spearman-Correlation-Coefficient available.
Select the columns by which the measurements should be grouped (example: plates, batches, runs...)

where it says "Use the following colum-filter for:", one can choose between the "batch-processing" modus, that calculates correlation between the subsets that have in all selected columns the same values. The "measurement-association" mode allows to associate measurement between subsets.
(First column filter) select one or more column to define the groups within the subsets. A particular group has the same value for all the selected columns.
Select the parameter to be correlated. If multiple parameter are calculated, The correlation value represents the average fingerprint correlation of a particular group.

ports.outPort: A table containg a row for each subset and group and the corresponding correlation values.
